reviewText: I have had this concert on Laserdisc (remember those?!) since the early 80's and back then I even had trouble finding it because it had only been released in Japan.So it's about time that this fabulous concert finds it's way onto DVD. If you're a fan of Gladys Knight like me, you will enjoy every single minute of it.It's not every day that you can look at history captured on film.Ray & Gladys at the top of their art.
summary: Nice to see this finally on DVD
Title: N/A

reviewText: I have never had the opportunity to see Gladys Knight in her prime in concert, so to see this DVD was a wonderful opportunity to see them live. I was not disappointed, Miss Knight was regal, funny and in full voice - the addition of Ray Charles for the last numbers was a real bonus.
Title: N/A

reviewText: 5 stars+ all the way!!!This is one "Super Great" Concert!!!! This was filmed at the Greek Theatre in Los Angeles, CA, during 1977. Gladys, the Pips, and Ray Charles are all fabulus. I tell you that Gladys can really sing. She is one of the best vocalist, I've ever heard. Her voice is very smooth, and you can feel the emotions,in the songs,she sings. She is cheerful, and she basically acts as the MC for the concert. She's at the "Top of Her Game" so to speak. Gladys even sings a couple of Barbara Streisand songs ("Evergreen" & "The Way We Were"). There is a great backing band included also. The total approximate running time is about 76 minutes.The concert consists of 16 songs:Key Songs include:By Gladys Knight & the Pips: "Best Thing That Ever Happened to Me"(Smooth, Emotional & Simply Outstanding), "Midnight Train to Georgia" (a Southern Classic, it makes you want to take that midnight train), "I've Got to Use My Imagination" and "I heard it Through the Grapevine".By Ray Charles: "America the Beautiful" (an awesome performance!!!)By Gladys Knight & Ray Charles (together):"Georgia On My Mind" (another Southern Classic)"Neither One of Us" (Awesome, & Emotional, and they artistically tie this song into the last song of the concert, making for a  perfect ending)"Hit the Road Jack" (Neither one of us wants to be the 1st to say goodbye, but somebody has to do it, so "Hit the Road Jack".)This is a "Classic" in my opinion. It's one of those concerts that everyone should hear. I highly recommend it!!! Thanks!!!!
summary: Gladys Knight & the Pips + Ray Charles (All From Georgia) at Their Very Best = 100% Outstanding!!!!!!!
Title: N/A

reviewText: This vid brings back Gladys Knight and the Pips at the peak of their powers. She does some of her greatest hits + a mini medley of two Barbra Streisand tunes with her own spin that are both dynamite! It is exactly what I was hoping to find when I ordered this disc--a time capsule of irreplaceable sentimental value as well as a top-notch production.
Title: N/A

reviewText: The dynamic Miss Gladys Knight and The Pips and the electrifying Brother Ray Charles give an outstanding show.  Though this show is over 30 years old, it is great to have these two, wonderful artists captured on the same stage.  I thoroughly enjoy watching this DVD.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Very enjoyable concert.  Viewing DVD is almost as good as seeing the concert live.  Recommend purchasing this DVD.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Five stars for the concert!!! However, since the dvd quality is so poor I had to give it 4 stars. The musical content is so great, it would be unfair (IMHO), to give this dvd a poor rating. Seeing the Pips grand stepping choreography as they sing along with Gladys is a keeper! Then, to see and hear Ray Charles is awesome....especially when he sings America the Beautiful!!!Note: whoever wrote the liner notes got their info wrong! Merald "Bubba" Knight is Gladys's brother!!! NOT her cousin!!!!
summary: Excellent concert! Very poor dvd video quality!
